properties.prefix:
Assembled Sequence


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the assembly being described.
properties.title: Assembly Name (ncbi)

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the sequence in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the sequence.
properties.title: Assembly Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the sequence (e.g. ploidy level, tropic level, relationship to oxygen.)
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). Select terms listed under class ploidy of Phenotypic Quality Ontology.
properties.title: Ploidy Level

properties.description: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph).
properties.title: Trophic Level

properties.description: Is the organism an aerobe or anaerobe. Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments.
properties.title: Relationship to Oxygen

properties.description: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure.
properties.title: Post Assembly Editing (ncbi)

properties.description: A chimeric sequence, or chimera for short, is a sequence comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences. Chimeras are usually PCR artifacts thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to a foreign DNA strand and is copied to completion in the following PCR cycles. The point at which the chimeric sequence changes from one paren to the net is call the breakpoint or conversion point.
properties.title: Chimera Check

properties.description: To what is the entity pathogenic.
properties.title: Known Pathogenicity

properties.description: This field is specific to different taxa.
properties.title: Propagation

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as ploidy level, tropic level, relationship to oxygen. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the material sample and related identifiers pertaining to the sample such as isolation and growth condition or multiplex identifiers.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: User generated identifier for this project.
properties.title: Project ID (ncbi)

properties.description: NCBI BioProject identifier.
properties.title: BioProject ID (ncbi)

properties.description: Material Sample identifier.
properties.title: Material Sample ID

properties.description: NCBI BioSample identifier.
properties.title: BioSample ID (ncbi)

properties.description: Molecular barcodes called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in upper case letters.
properties.title: Multiplex Identifiers

properties.description: If there is a host involved, provide its taon id (or enviromental if not actually isolated from the dead or alive host - i.e. pathogen could be isolated from a swipe of a bench, etc.) and report whether it is a laboratory or natural host)
properties.title: Specific Host

properties.description: The NCBI taxonomy identifier of the specific host if it is known.
properties.title: Host Specificity or Range

properties.description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID, digital object identifier, or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material.
properties.title: Isolation and Growth Condition

properties.description: Other identifiers that are not covered in the identifiers above.
A reference to a source item from which the sequence was derived.
properties.title: Source

properties.description: The type of source.
properties.title: Source Type

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the sequence such as the project within which the sequencing was organized, related publications, references or resources, SOPs, or biotic relationships.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized.
properties.title: Project Name

properties.description: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report.
properties.title: BioMaterial Reference

properties.description: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed.
properties.title: Observed Biotic Relationship

properties.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure.
properties.title: Nucleic Acid Extraction

properties.description: Link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure.
properties.title: Nucleic Acid Amplification

properties.description: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences.
properties.title: Relevant Standard Operating Procedures

properties.description: For cases where annotation was provided by a community or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter.
properties.title: Annotation Source

properties.description: The type of relationship being described.
properties.title: Relationship Type

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions relevant to your understanding of the sequence such as finishing strategy, base level quality, linkage quality or encoded traits.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: Brief description about how the assembly program determines base level quality. If submitting AGP files, how was linkage quality determined. For example, if linkage is based on mate pairs, what was the minimum number of mates required to determine linkage.
properties.title: Base Level Quality Description (ncbi)

properties.description: If submitting AGP files, how was linkage quality determined. For example, if linkage is based on mate pairs, what was the minimum number of mates required to determine linkage.
properties.title: Linkage Quality Description (ncbi)

properties.description: Was the project intended to produce a complete or draft genome; coverage, the fold coverage of the sequencing expressed as 2x, 3x, 18x, etc, and how many contigs were produced for the genome.
properties.title: Finishing Strategy

properties.description: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage.
properties.title: Encoded Traits

properties.description: Other notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the sequence.
properties.title: Other Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as finishing strategy, sequence quality, known pathogenicity, propogation, or encoded traits.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the sequence, such as the date the sample was collected or the date the sequence was submitted to the appropriate archive.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: Depending on the study, sequences have to be submitted to SRA, DRA or Genbank.
properties.title: Date Submitted to INSDC

properties.description: The type of time period being described such as Date Collected, Date Analyzed, etc.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the time period being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Current or historical spatial location information about the sample being described, such as geographical origin of the sample.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: Geographical origin of the sample.
properties.title: Geographic Origin Information

properties.description: Geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country, sea name, region or specific location.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: Geographic origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees.
properties.title: Latitude and Longitude

properties.description: Other places related to the assembled sequence.
properties.title: Other Places

properties.description: The type of place being described such as the collection place or geographical origin of the sample.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the sequence.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of time period related to the place.
properties.title: Place Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a relationship to the sequence. For example, the person who authored it, or an organization which funded its creation.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of a person related to the sequence, such as contact person, reference author or sequence author. At least one sequence author and one contact is required for ncbi submission.
properties.title: Role (ncbi)

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The type of contact being described such as Office.
properties.title: Contact Type

properties.description: The type of phone being described such as Office, Cell or Other
properties.title: Phone Type

properties.description: The type of email being described such as Office or personal.
properties.title: Email Type

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the sequence such as submitting organization and department.
properties.title: Role (ncbi)

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name (ncbi)

properties.description: The Taxonomic Classification of the species referenced in the sequence.
properties.title: Taxonomic Classification

properties.description: The name of the genus.
properties.title: Genus Name

properties.description: The name of the species.
properties.title: Species Name

properties.description: This should provide further informaton about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information (i.e. biovar, serovar, serotype, biovar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group 1 Plasmid.
properties.title: Sub-specific Genetic Lineage

properties.description: Other variants not covered in the above Taxonomic fields.
properties.title: Variants

properties.description: The condition of the host at time of collection.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection.
properties.title: Health or Disease Status

properties.description: The environmental context of the sample including biome, feature, material and environmental package.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: Biomes are defined based on factors such as plant structures, leaf types, plant spacing, and other factors like climate. Biome should be treated as the descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. For example, desert, taiga, deciduous woodland or coral reef.
properties.title: Environmental Biome

properties.description: Environment feature level includes geographic environmental features. Compared to biome, feature is a descriptor of the more local environment. For example, harbor, cliff or lake.
properties.title: Environmental Feature

properties.description: Environment feature level refers to the material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Environmental material terms are generally mass nouns. For example, air, soil or water.
properties.title: Environmental Material

properties.description: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extenson for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained.
properties.title: Environmental Package

properties.description: The format of the sequence.
properties.title: Format

properties.description: The type of format being described.
properties.title: Format Type

properties.description: Describe any relevant methods used to collect or enhance the dataset.
properties.title: Methods

properties.description: The type of sequencing that was done (e.g. whole genome, transcriptome, targeted sequencing).
properties.title: Sequencing Type

properties.description: Sequencing technology used to generate reads.

index.key: MORE THAN ONE OF THE ABOVE

options.index: MORE THAN ONE OF THE ABOVE

properties.title: Sequencing Technology (ncbi)

properties.description: Assembly program and version used to generate the sequence.
properties.title: Assembly Program and Version (ncbi)

properties.description: The method or device employed for collecting the sample.
properties.title: Sample Collection Method or Device

properties.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment. Can use OBI terms.
properties.title: Sample Material Processing

properties.description: Library construction method used for clone libraries.
properties.title: Library Construction Method

properties.description: Cloning vector types used in construction of libraries.
properties.title: Library Vector

properties.description: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries.
properties.title: Library Screening

properties.description: How was the assembly done (e.g. with a text based assembler like phrap or a flowgram assembler); estimated error rate associated with the finished sequences (e.g. error rate of 1 in 1000 bp); and the method of calculation.
properties.title: Assembly Method

properties.description: Other methods that are not covered in the methods above.
properties.title: Method Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the method used.
properties.title: Method

properties.description: Describe any relevant techniques used to enhance the sequence.
properties.title: Techniques

properties.description: Experimental factors are the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments. If possible use terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI).
properties.title: Experimental Factors

properties.description: Other techniques used to enhance the sequence that are not referenced above.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the technique.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: Describe any relevant treatments pertaining to the sequence (e.g. target gene, sub-fragment, pcr primers, adapters, pcr conditions, etc.)
properties.title: Treatments

properties.description: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies.
properties.title: Targeted Gene

properties.description: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to identify special regions on marker genes like V6 or 16S rRNA.
properties.title: Target Subfragment

properties.description: PCR Primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment.
properties.title: PCR Primers

properties.description: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of initial denaturation: degrees minutes; annealing: degrees minutes' elongation: degrees minutes; final elongation: defrees minutes; total cycles.
properties.title: PCR Conditions

properties.description: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported in uppercase letters.
properties.title: Adapters

properties.description: The type of treatment (e.g. target gene, sub-fragment, pcr primers, adapters, pcr conditions, etc.)
properties.title: Treatment Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the treatment.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: Numeric descriptions pertaining to the sequence such as the depth or elevation in the environmental packages, number of replicons, number of extrachromosmal elements, number of base pairs, amount or size of sample collected, total number of clones, or total number of clones sequenced from the library.
properties.title: MIxS Measurements

properties.description: The amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected.
properties.title: Sample Size

properties.description: The elevation pertaining to the geographical origin of the sample being sequenced.
properties.title: Elevation

properties.description: The depth pertaining to the geographical origin of the sample being sequenced.
properties.title: Depth

properties.description: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing.
properties.title: Estimated Size

properties.description: The sequence depth or how many times the sample was sequenced.
properties.title: Sequence Coverage (ncbi)

properties.description: For example, 10 for 10x coverage.
properties.title: Value

properties.description: Number of chromosomes.
properties.title: Number of Chromosomal Elements

properties.description: Reports the number of Replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote.
properties.title: Number of Replicons

properties.description: Total number of clones sequenced from the library.
properties.title: Library Reads Sequenced

properties.description: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project.
properties.title: Library Size

properties.description: Other numeric descriptions pertaining to the sequence.
properties.title: Other Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are described using text.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: Measurements intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of date being described such as Date Collected, Date Modified, etc.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the entity being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy
